Title: Hirsutella uncinata, a new hyphomycete from Australia.
Abstract:
Hirsutella uncinata, collected on follicles of Hakea sp.
in New South Wales, Australia, is described as a new anamorph species.
The fungus produces stiff, erect, verticillate conidiophores with up to
ten whorls of recurved, phialidic conidiogenous cells that have
rough-walled necks. The conidia are subfusiform, flattened on one side
and produced in groups of two to three in a dense mucoid ball at the end
of each phialide. Parsimony analysis of aligned internal transcribed
spacer rDNA sequences suggests that H. uncinata is closely related to
the Cordyceps sinensis complex (Clavicipitaceae, Hypocreales), which
includes species with morphologically similar anamorphs.
